thread.title: Bus service cost almost £150,000
thread.title_full: Bus service cost almost £150,000 | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Bus service cost almost £150,000
text:
A new Guernsey bus service has cost almost £150,000 and brought in just £1,724 of income.
Leasing the vehicle and paying the driver for the P1 parish service cost £463 per day.
However just 3,330 people have used the service.
The service was introduced last October and is due to stop when the winter timetable comes in next month.
The figures emerged due to questions during Guernsey States meeting this morning.
Environment Minister, Deputy Yvonne Burford, said that the P1 route was designed to link facilities in the west such as doctors' surgeries, churches and post offices as the area is traditionally under-served.
However, she admitted that the take-up had been disappointing and said the service would be redeployed to other areas when the new winter timetable begins.
Last updated Tue 29 Sep 2015 Travel Guernsey
